title: Russian soldier pleads guilty in first war crimes trial of Ukraine conflict
description: The 21-year-old admits killing an unarmed civilian, in Ukraine's first war crimes trial since war began.

title: Pennsylvania primary: Trump-backed 'Dr Oz' in cliffhanger vote count
description: Celebrity surgeon Mehmet Oz's bid to become the next Republican senator from Pennsylvania is in jeopardy.

title: AG Perarivalan: India top court frees killer of ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi
description: AG Perarivalan spent 30 years in jail for procuring batteries used in the bomb to kill India's former PM.

title: US Soccer equal-pay deal could 'change game globally'
description: An equal-pay agreement between the United States men's and women's teams has been hailed as potentially "changing the game around the world".

title: McDonald's and Wendy's sued for burger ads that mislead on size
description: A lawsuit accuses the firms of advertising burgers that look bigger than they actually are.

title: China Eastern plane crash likely intentional, US reports say
description: Flight data reportedly indicates someone in the cockpit made the China Eastern Airlines jet crash.

title: Cyclone Yakecan batters Uruguay and Brazil
description: At least two people are dead and hundreds of thousands have been left without electricity.

title: Gambler to pay back Japanese Covid-19 fund he spent
description: The man's lawyer said his client gambled the pay-out after it was mistakenly paid to his bank account.

title: US military probe finds no wrongdoing in deadly Syria air strike
description: Dozens of people, including women and children, were killed in the 2019 strike on an IS position.

title: Cyclist abandons race after popping cork in eye
description: Italy's Alberto Dainese is a surprise winner of stage 11 of the Giro d'Italia after Biniam Girmay was forced to abandon this year's race.

title: Lancet study: Pollution killed 2.3 million Indians in 2019
description: The report found that nearly 1.6 million deaths in India were due to air pollution alone.

title: Ukraine war: 'I had to stay below ground for more than 60 days'
description: Katerina spent more than two months beneath the besieged Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine.

title: Mariupol's Azovstal fighters: What next for Ukraine's captured soldiers
description: Ukraine wants to exchange them for Russian prisoners of war, but some in Russia want them put on trial.

title: Capitol riots loom large in Republican primaries
description: Deniers of the 2020 election results are among the biggest winners of the Republican primary

title: Afghanistan: The secret girls school defying the Taliban
description: The teachers fear being arrested or beaten after the Taliban banned most teenage girls from education.

title: Australia election: A simple guide
description: Australians go to the polls on 21 May, for the country's first election since 2019.

title: Philly Lutaaya: The Ugandan singer who led the fight against HIV prejudice
description: HIV-positive Ugandan singer Philly Lutaaya was ostracised by some but his openness shifted attitudes.

title: Måneskin's crazy rise to fame: 'We only slept in our own beds 10 times last year'
description: The Italian rock band relive the highs and lows of becoming a global success after winning Eurovision.

title: Lebanon election results raise spectre of new power struggle
description: Prolonged deadlock could ensue after Hezbollah's allies lost seats to their rivals, says Anna Foster.

title: Mariupol: Key moments in the siege of the city
description: As Ukrainian fighters are evacuated from the Azovstal steelworks, how Russia has closed in on the city.

title: Buffalo shooting: How far-right killers are radicalised online
description: A movement of online extremists targets innocent people in shooting rampages that follow a similar blueprint.

title: Anti-abortion groups target women with misleading ads
description: Abortion providers describe a battle to put out accurate information.

title: Woman kidnapped as a child reunites with rescuer
description: Kathy Wrethman, from Australia, has finally come face-to-face with the man who saved her life.

title: China's silenced feminist: How Sophia Huang Xueqin went missing
description: BBC Eye investigates the disappearance of Sophia Huang Xueqin, a high-profile feminist journalist who kick-started China’s #MeToo movement.

title: Scott Morrison crashes into a boy during football match
description: Scott Morrison was playing five-a-side on the campaign trail ahead of Australia's election on Saturday.

title: Sweden and Finland formally submit Nato applications
description: The alliance's secretary general Jens Stoltenberg says it is "a historic moment, which we must seize".

title: Colombian robbery victim crashes car into thieves
description: The thieves stole a watch and mobile phone before the victim drove into them in his convertible.
